intro: Erigeron heteromorphus, commonly known as the heteromorphic fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron heteromorphus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
